p: In conclusion, the anti-inflammatory activity of LEO is evidenced by its inhibition of the production of NO, PGE 2, and other cytokines (e.g., TNF-α and IL-6) via regulation of the NF-κB and MAPK pathways. These results suggest that the development of substances that modulate the expression of pro-inflammatory mediators can provide a molecular basis for developing functional foods for the treatment of various inflammatory diseases.
